Why scientists are divided over whether there is a 'sixth mass extinction'
description: American researchers have reignited the debate over the concept by publishing an article that questions the idea of a new mass extinction event that is comparable in scale to the one that wiped out the dinosaurs.

headline: Hamas says Gaza conquest plan shows Israel's 'blatant disregard' for mediation

In China, the electric car sector is facing the challenge of overcapacity
description: With the domestic market saturated and undergoing major changes, auto giant BYD's sales are dropping. Now, it is relying on exports to weather the storm.

headline: 'Heat waves can act as a sudden trigger for eco-anxiety'
description: Hélène Jalin, a clinical psychologist and researcher at the Université de Nantes, discusses in an interview with Le Monde the role heat waves play in triggering or reactivating eco-anxiety.

headline: La Piscine in Roubaix invites visitors to take a plunge into culture
description: 'Unusual places for an exhibition' (3/6). Le Monde explores six art centers housed in unique locations. Today: an Art Deco building transformed in 2001 into La Piscine Museum of Art and Industry in northern France.

headline: On the 'art of shunning' – and the risks that come with it
description: 'Letters from America' (4/6). Writer and journalist Thomas Chatterton Williams considers the dangers of cancel culture and wokism. It is better to engage in dialogue, even if it is difficult, in the real world than to 'punish and ostracize' on social media, he says.

France faces prospect of paying higher borrowing costs than Italy
description: Rome has significantly reduced its public deficit over the past three years, while Paris has allowed its own to spiral. In the eyes of investors, Italy is now as credible as France, despite a heavier debt burden. On the markets, the gap in interest rates between the two countries has nearly vanished.

headline: What is Kick, the platform on which a French streamer died live?
description: Raphaël Grave, known online as Jean Pormanove, died Monday during a livestream. The tragedy has shed light on a little-known streaming site and its extremely permissive moderation policies.

headline: AI, my students and me: 'Last semester marks the nadir of my experience in academia'
description: 'Letters from America' (1/6). The writer and journalist Thomas Chatterton Williams has been startled by the omnipresence of artificial intelligence at university, which he believes threatens the very foundations of education and our ability to think.
